title: StickyWindows configuration
description: Schema describing the sticky windows configuration in Glue42 Desktop

targetMode.description: Property that changes the functional behavior depending on the selected platform.

snapDistance.description: Distance at which windows should snap (stick) together.

approachingDistance.description: Distance at which approaching edges will be highlighted.

edgeDistance.description: Distance between the edges of snapped windows.

snapToScreenEdges.description: Enable/disable snapping to the screen edges.

autoSnap.description: Auto snap windows on end of the snapping operation (mouse up). Windows are snapped to the approaching edges (if any).

autoCollapse.description: Auto collapse windows when on moving/sizing operations they will go out of the screen.

autoArrange.description: Auto arrange (move windows around) when removing a window from a group.

autoAlign.description: Align the window (change size/location) to the neighbour windows when adding it to a group.

hideGroupCaption.description: Caption in groups will be not visible

autoRemoveWindows.description: Auto remove local windows when they are destroyed.

unlockTimeout.description: Specifies the timeout (in ms) to wait before unlocking windows from the group on a long mouse press.

unlockTolerance.description: Specifies the distance (in px) allowed for the mouse to move from its initial position and unlocking to be still available.

minimumWindowSize.description: Specifies the minimum window size which will be used if no minimum width/height is set by the user. If the value is 0 (or less), this setting will not be used.

debugWindow.description: Specifies the debug window support behavior. The default is `Disabled`.

movingGroupsFromTopWindowOnly.description: If `true`, moving a window group is allowed only from the top window (and from the group header as well).

enableCrossProcess.description: Enables communication between different processes that use Glue42 windows. This is used to allow .NET and Java applications to use Glue42 windows.

sizingMode.description: `Proportional` - moving the inner borders of a window group does not change the size of the entire group, only resizes the windows inside the group. `Single` - moving the inner borders of a window group will result in a push/pull resize of the entire group.

groupMaximizedMode.description: Defines the behavior of a window with size restrictions which will be violated during resize operations with Windows gestures. `Proportional` - the proportions of all windows in the group will be preserved relatively to the size of the restricted window. `Fill` - the group will be resized in a way that the unsrestricted windows will fill as much space as possible. (Only rectangular groups without holes are currently supported.)

enableSwimlaneFrameDropShadow.description: Enables drop shadow sizing border around swimlane frame window.

enableWindowGroupsDropShadow.description: Enables drop shadow borders for Glue42 Window groups.

flydownShowDelay.description: The delay in ms before showing the flydown window after the user hovers over the flydown zone.

flydownChangeDelay.description: Delay in ms allowing the callback for handling the flydown window to return a result when changing the flydown zone.

flydownHideDelay.description: The delay in ms before hiding the flydown window (e.g., when the user moves the cursor out of the flydown zone).

flydownHideCheckInterval.description: Interval in ms at which the system will check whether the flydown window should be hidden. Its value should be less than the value of `flydownHideDelay`, otherwise the flydown window will be hidden at the end of the interval specified here and not at the end of the delay specified in `flydownHideDelay`.

enableStickiness.description: Controls the stickiness of Glue42 Windows.

buttonsAlwaysVisible.description: If `true`, the buttons in a tab group will be always visible. Otherwise, they will show only on hover.

flatWhenSingle.description:
When `true`, the tab window will look as a flat window (without a tab header) when it is single.
            Tabs will appear automatically when you add one or more tab windows to it.
